name: spookily
content:

in a way that is strange and sometimes frightening: Spookily, nobody knows where it came from. His predictions were spookily accurate.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the photo, the schoolboys glow spookily, like a pair of ghosts. Weekday evenings in the city can be spookily quiet, but the bars and restaurants fill up at the weekend.The painting is a spookily lifelike depiction of a 15th century priest.Spookily, the two sisters had very similar accidents on exactly the same day.
